holidays.name: International Day of Peace
holidays.description: A day dedicated to promoting peace among nations and peoples, encouraging ceasefires and non-violence worldwide.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 1981 to promote peace and end violence internationally.
holidays.funFact: On this day, many people release doves or participate in peace ceremonies, and some airports even halt all activities for a minute of silence.

holidays.name: Miniature Golf Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the quirky fun of miniature golf, a whimsical twist on regular golf with creative obstacle courses!
holidays.origin: Began as a popular unofficial day among mini-golf enthusiasts to celebrate putting and silly courses.
holidays.funFact: The first miniature golf course was created in 1916 and was known as 'Tom Thumb Golf'‚Äîafter the famous fairy tale character!

holidays.name: World Rhino Day
holidays.description: An awareness day focused on protecting rhinos and their habitats from poaching and extinction.
holidays.origin: Started in 2010 by the World Wildlife Fund to highlight rhino conservation efforts globally.
holidays.funFact: Only five species of rhinos exist today, and they are critically endangered due to poaching for their horns.

holidays.name: Proud To Be Polish Day
holidays.description: A celebration of Polish heritage, culture, and pride by people of Polish descent around the world.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day embraced by Polish communities worldwide to honor their roots and traditions.
